result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Kimbel

defendant.name: Kimbel, Robert J
defendant.address: W310 S432 Maple Ave, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Attorney Kathleen Cruz for Glenn Edward Gaskill III in court for Robert J Kimbel.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. 
Defense requests a deadline to file motions with a status hearing shortly after the deadline.
Court orders any and all motions except trial motions be filed by 11/30/22.
Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:29 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill III in court for Robert J Kimbel. Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Gaskill provides an update, he has an offer but needs more time to review it with his client.  Atty. Gaskill requests a further proceedings date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

08:42 AM Attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill in court.   Defendant Robert J Kimbel did not appear.   Authorization to appear received and filed.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Gaskill states he was just retained and states he needs both discovery and pretrial offer.
ADA Schaller states there is a pretrial offer and will forward to attorney Gaskill.
The parties don't object to a new date.
The Court adjourns.
ADA Schaller states there  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

09:05 AM Defendant Robert J Kimbel in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
